item.title: Build a R package for yourself
item.description: A normal R user can benefit a lot from building packages. You donâ€™t need to be R developer to write packages. Developers write packages for others; you just write packages for yourself. As a R user, you must have written functions and collected datasets, and some you want to use across projects or you want to use later. The conventional way to reuse them is to copy and paste them to the new project or to load them by source(xxx.
